definitions: water (esp. cool, fresh water, e.g. drinking water)
illness (usu. excluding minor ailments, e.g. common cold)
cat (esp. the domestic cat, Felis catus)
to be able (in a position) to do
to be up to the task
to move (in a direction or towards a specific location)
to get on (train, plane, bus, ship, etc.)
to hang up (e.g. a coat, a picture on the wall)
low (rank, degree, value, content, quality, etc.)
to fall (of rain, snow, ash, etc.)
to go out (e.g. on an excursion or outing)
to take (a resource, e.g. time or money)
to play (a stringed or keyboard instrument)
feeling light (i.e. offering little resistance, moving easily)
cup (drinking vessel, measure, brassiere, prize, etc.)
